ARION-SDB.ST.summary: Arion banki hf. provides various financial services to households, corporates, and investors in Iceland and internationally. It operates through three segments: Retail Banking, Corporate & Investment Banking, and Markets. The Retail Banking segment offers a range of products and services, including mortgage loans, savings and current accounts, vehicle and equipment financing, factoring, payment cards, pension services, and insurance and funds to individuals and SMEs through a network of 19 branches with approximately 100,000 customers. The Corporate & Investment Banking segment provides a range of lending products, such as guarantees, deposit accounts, payment solutions, and value-added digital solutions to large and medium-sized corporate clients and investors; international transactions; and various financial advisory and capital raising services, including M&A and LBO services, as well as financial structuring advice, and services on public offerings of securities. The Markets segment manages financial assets on behalf of its customers, as well as a range of mutual, investment, and institutional investor funds; administers pension funds; and provides various fixed income services and risk management products. The company also offers liquidity, currency, and interest rate management services, as well as handles various debt issuance in the domestic and foreign markets, and maintaining its credit ratings; provides non-life and life insurance; and invests in properties. The company was founded in 2008 and is headquartered in ReykjavÃ­k, Iceland.

KVIKA.IC.summary: Kvika banki hf., a specialized bank, provides asset management and investment products and services in Iceland and the United Kingdom. Its products and services include fund management services; finances to enterprises; loans to institutional investors; financing solutions, including project financing, portfolio financing, bridge lending, mezzanine lending, and wholesale funding for fintech solution providers; securities brokerage and foreign exchange market services; and advisory services related to investments and financing with a focus on corporate acquisitions and divestments, and initial public offerings. The company's products and services also include investment banking services with a focus on acquisitions, divestments and mergers, financing and financial restructuring, and listings and delisting of equities and bonds; services to listed companies and companies seeking to list on a regulated stock exchange; and private banking and deposit products and services to high-net worth individuals, businesses, and market participants. It also provides property and casualty, marine, and life and health insurance products and services primarily in Iceland; asset leasing products and services by financing commercial equipment, real estate, and vehicles for companies and individuals; and operational lease services. The company was founded in 1956 and is headquartered in Reykjavik, Iceland.

The company offers motor vehicle, family and home, life and critical illness, and medical cost insurance products for individuals. It also provides commercial insurance products, such as fire and commercial property insurance; public and product liability, employer's liability, directors and officers liability, professional indemnity, and commercial liability insurance; operation interruption insurance; vessel crew, hull and machinery, and catch and fishing gear/tackle insurance; vessel cargo, transport cargo, and purse seine insurance; baggage, sickness and accidents on travelling, and cancelation insurance; and insurance products for employees and leaders.
